channel.title: Arg! they are trying to stop me e-vents

.....
1149660015625 sent java.awt.event.MouseEvent[MOUSE_MOVED,(206,212),button=0,clickCount=0] on canvas2 1149660015640 sent java.awt.event.MouseEvent[MOUSE_MOVED,(204,212),button=0,clickCount=0] on canvas2 1149660015656 sent java.awt.event.MouseEvent[MOUSE_MOVED,(202,212),button=0,clickCount=0] on canvas2 Caught exception in UBI: java.awt.EventQueue.invokeLater(Unknown Source) sun.awt.im.InputContext.removeNotify(Unknown Source) java.awt.Component.removeNotify(Unknown Source) java.awt.Container.remove(Unknown Source) java.awt.Container.remove(Unknown Source) oa.a(oa.java:231) client.g(client.java:925) oa.f(oa.java:314) oa.run(oa.java:414) java.lang.Thread.run(Unknown Source) 1149660015750 sent java.awt.event.MouseEvent[MOUSE_EXITED,(202,212),button=0,clickCount=0] on canvas2 1149660015750 sent java.awt.event.MouseEvent[MOUSE_ENTERED,(202,212),button=0,clickCount=0] on panel0 1149660015843 sent java.awt.event.MouseEvent[MOUSE_MOVED,(212,204),button=0,clickCount=0] on panel0 1149660015859 sent java.awt.event.MouseEvent[MOUSE_EXITED,(212,204),button=0,clickCount=0] on panel0 1149660015859 sent java.awt.event.MouseEvent[MOUSE_ENTERED,(212,204),button=0,clickCount=0] on canvas3 1149660015859 sent java.awt.event.MouseEvent[MOUSE_MOVED,(212,204),button=0,clickCount=0] on canvas3 1149660015875 sent java.awt.event.FocusEvent[FOCUS_GAINED,permanent,opposite=null] on canvas3 1149660015875 sent java.awt.event.MouseEvent[MOUSE_MOVED,(224,177),button=0,clickCount=0] on canvas3 1149660015875 sent java.awt.event.MouseEvent[MOUSE_MOVED,(228,166),button=0,clickCount=0] on canvas3 1149660015890 sent java.awt.event.MouseEvent[MOUSE_MOVED,(230,154),button=0,clickCount=0] on canvas3 1149660015890 sent java.awt.event.MouseEvent[MOUSE_MOVED,(232,146),button=0,clickCount=0] on canvas3 [/CODE]
Looks like Jagsex added listeners from to a canvas. They are also destroying the canvas frequently and re-constructing it all re-constructing the listeners. I already have a coded for the issue and in the end it will make UBI stronger.

item.title: Arg! they are trying to stop me e-vents
item.dc:creator: @Xerxes Xerxes
item.description:
@Xerxes wrote:

Ruler, click on the X on top of your browser, thanks. <3

Read full topic
item.source: Arg! they are trying to stop me e-vents

item.title: Arg! they are trying to stop me e-vents
item.dc:creator: @moparisthebest Moparisthebest
item.description:
@moparisthebest wrote:

ruler:

[quote author=moparisthebest link=topic=4456.msg44604#msg44604 date=1149713978]
[quote author=ruler link=topic=4456.msg44598#msg44598 date=1149713590]
[quote author=moparisthebest link=topic=4456.msg44592#msg44592 date=1149713252]
my webclient sends mouse events TO THE BROWSER, jagex can change anything and everything that they want to, but as long as the game is played from a browser, my webclient will work perfectly, think about it ;D

I already coded around it.

So you have a java web browser? If so then your saying then they all reside on the same runtime? If so then you need to watch for some traps.
[/quote]

actually I wrap mozilla (or ie, the users choice) inside my java webclient, so I can send mousevents to them, the applet is actually running in a webbrowser, seperate of the webclient, there is no way for jagex to know the difference bewtween this and normal playing
[/quote]
are you using mozilla's open-source for this?
are you able to manage focus?
Does the java runtime->java application->jni->c++ application->java runtime->java applet.
Do you get 2 or 1 runtime?[/quote]

actually its 2 java runtimes (2 copies of java.exe running), and one native executable (its still compatible with all OSes), basically the browser is wrapped into an AWT component which I can do anything I like with, such as send mouse and key events

yes youll probably have to have one beast of a computer to run a whole heck of a lot of these, but Ill probably make a lite version just for use with SCAR, without the fancy features all built in

Read full topic
item.source: Arg! they are trying to stop me e-vents

item.title: Arg! they are trying to stop me e-vents
item.dc:creator: @ruler ruler
item.description:
@ruler wrote:

moparisthebest:

[quote author=ruler link=topic=4456.msg44598#msg44598 date=1149713590]
[quote author=moparisthebest link=topic=4456.msg44592#msg44592 date=1149713252]
[quote author=RLN link=topic=4456.msg44562#msg44562 date=1149709731]
I wasted about 10 seconds of my life reading what you wrote.

rofl me too

but this is only because your not doing it the right way ruler, my webclient sends mouse events TO THE BROWSER, jagex can change anything and everything that they want to, but as long as the game is played from a browser, my webclient will work perfectly, think about it ;D
[/quote]
I already coded around it.

So you have a java web browser? If so then your saying then they all reside on the same runtime? If so then you need to watch for some traps.
[/quote]

actually I wrap mozilla (or ie, the users choice) inside my java webclient, so I can send mousevents to them, the applet is actually running in a webbrowser, seperate of the webclient, there is no way for jagex to know the difference bewtween this and normal playing [/quote]
are you using mozilla's open-source for this?
are you able to manage focus?
Does the java runtime->java application->jni->c++ application->java runtime->java applet.
Do you get 2 or 1 runtime?

You noticed, props! They only just recently added it.

I have it coded too. Of course, i've worked around all of it for quite some time. Hehe stop spoofing listeners... Start spoofing toolkits and stacks :-p, doesnt matter how many times they create recreate, they're still on the same stack.


Thanks, your solution sounds intresting. Mine is a bit crude, but it works. My position in the stack is in the awt thread.

Read full topic
